Horrible decoration, a lot of empty tables, there was also huge, empty  room which was blocked off from entering with some kind of chain.  This place need renovation badly. In the dining area where people are sitting , next to the wall,  they have  something what look like registration desk at the hotel (!!)  Employees are staying there all the time and they watching and gossiping about their customers.    I requested to sit at the table but my friend wanted to have booth seating - after we changed our seating request we got a huge attitude from the waiter ( place was almost empty, just few  guests ).   She brought us to the booth - it is important to mention that she never welcomed us nor introduced herself  -  being polite and to smile when approaching customers seem not important to her.  RUDE as rude can be. We ordered salad with eggs as appetizer and we asked for a different salad dressing because salad came with some kind of nuts dressing.  It was impossible for our waiter to get a different dressing for us.  She claimed it cannot be done! Salad looked old and brownish, it was suppose to be dinner salad but it was in size of  side salad,  served in very unattractive way. Then we ordered yellow curry - number 2 on the menu -  and Phad thai Noodles.  Yellow curry was not yellow.  It  was in  brown/green color,  it was not cooked fresh , I could tell that chicken was pre cooked probably day or two before , because it was totally dry and without taste.  There was no onions in the curry, but there was  one huge potato half raw and three small pieces of carrot. It was the worse thai curry I have ever had in my life. I did not eat my curry and I informed waiter how I feel about the food.  She did not apologize for food quality at all.  She just took my plate away!  Phad Thai looked like spaghetti bolognese - it had some kind of brown,nasty looking sauce on it.  It definitely did not  look or taste like Phad Thai.   It was horrible dining experience starting from ambience continuing with their service and ending with food. I did pay for my food which I did not eat,  leaving waiter with tip in zero amount. Her tip was well deserved. I  recommend staying away from this dive.

Aww, we discovered an oasis in the desert. An unassuming exterior. Once you step inside you feel the that this is the real deal. Just what we were looking for. In the lobby there are the most beautiful paintings of Thai traditions. The entrance has lush plants arranged just so. The restaurant has plenty of space. You won't ever feel crowed. The servers are so very nice. Respectful even. Reasonable prices. The food is the main thing right? We were so impressed. It has become our favorite Thai restaurant in the Surprise area. They deserve a great review!!

Red Curry is Thai-mazing!  Back for more ....ordered Khao Soi (Norther Thai curry noodle) spicy which was delicious but not enough curry, didn't care for the wontons on top, I prefer it when's done w the extras to add, owner said they will customize. The red curry shrimp was delectable w the bamboo shoots done perfectly...Savory!

We love going to Line Thai!  The friendly service with their huge smiles are always a wonderful welcome.   The pricing is great, especially during lunch.  We love their Thai Ice Tea -- what a sweet treat! We've tried a variety of their dishes and have never been disappointed.  The atmosphere is nothing fancy, just a simple, family-owned joint, doing a great job!

My friends and I were regulars at Thai Rama (Camelback) about 14 years ago.  Part of the reason we loved it so much was because of Ms. Chaiyasut.  She was always so sweet and remembered our favorite dishes.  After recently moving to the west valley, I started searching for legit Thai food places.  Stumbled upon a New Times review of Line Thai and was stoked to learn that Ms. C had taken it over!  I had been to Thai Rama twice after she left and the flavor (food and service) was not the same.  Went in to Line Thai last Sunday and it was like re-living some of the best times and food I can remember!  I went prepared to pig out in stretchy pants and had my favorites: fish patties for appetizer, phat prig King w/ beef, and sticky rice w/ mango for dessert.  Service was great, food was PERFECT and I can't wait to take my friends on the next trip!  Thank you!!!
This is one of the few places where I can ask for it Thai Hot and it comes out hot enough to bring sweat to my forehead.  Pure hell for some, but heaven on earth for me!

I would have given this restaurant 5 stars but I had to compare it to Tom Yum. Tom Yum had more flavor, and they are able to accommodate your spice level. The curry here was spicy even though we asked for no spice. Other than that. The flavor was good and good quantity and quality for the money. The only other complaint I would have is the water is sink water, and nobody likes that.

5 stars for the staff, the service, cleanliness and food. Been eating here since 2009 and the food only gets better. My fave is the chicken and prawns pad Thai, though I've tried different items on the menu and seems that everything I've tried was delicious.   Ate here two weeks ago and was slightly disappointed with the portion sizes. It seems to have become smaller. But, I stand by my 5  rating.

This is my favorite Thai restaurant. Every time I've been there the food has been excellent and the service great. The staff keeps the restaurant clean which is very important to me. The only negative is that it closes from 2 PM to 4 PM each day, so I can't have an early dinner or a late lunch.

Today I'm sadden, I have been eating Thai Food from locations mostly on the east side, we happen to see this location and decided to try.  Mi Krob is my favorite appetizer except for Satay (beef) with peanut sauce.  The Mi Krob was NOT cooked (actually partially uncooked) correctly and tasted of dirty oil and maybe sweet and sour sauce gone wrong.  Shared with the server but instead server just said would you like to take home. Mi took it home becuz wanted a second opinion, they agreed nasty ended in the trash.    The Pha Thai was okay except shrimp were not cooked crunchy.  Peanut sauce was okay.  What I did notice was that most people stuck with menu items that are more Chinese style than Thai.   Prices were $$$ pricey.  I'll stick to the East side for Thai Food.  I've read some of the reviews and comment on soup right on...  Save your money and go East Phoenix for Real Thai Food.

Consistently tasty food, generous portions, and always excellent service.  There was one quirky little thing on their menu.   Thai Iced Tea -- $2.50 Thai I.Tea without ice -- $3 Owning restaurants myself, I understand why the higher price but you just can't sweat those picky little price details, especially something that must not come up that often.  Makes me wonder if they are willing to cut costs too severely in the kitchen, also.
This is my new favorite Thai spot. The food has been amazing, and the staff is so nice! So glad I found Line Thai!

Not bad, not fantastic. I have had some pretty great Thai.  Went in for lunch and got the red curry and yellow curry specials, as well as pad thai.  The yellow curry was dark, and kind of like gravy. The potatoes were cooked all the way through, and smashed easily when pressed with a fork. I've had better.   The red curry was served with chicken, green beans, and bamboo shoots. It was looser and orange colored. Kind of like coconut milk with a hint of red curry, however it had good flavor and heat.   The pad thai tasted like you would want and expect.   Service was good, very accommodating to my 1 year old. They brought him soup complimentary. They did forget to bring our check though, we had to walk up to ask for it.  Overall, it was decent Thai. I would try a few other spots to see if there is one I favor in the area.

My husband and I stopped in for lunch.  We were pleasantly surprised at how immaculate and lovely the restaurant is inside, and impressed that we were immediately seated. The rest of our visit the waiter was attentive and prompt. The food was very tasty, and the atmosphere quite and peaceful.  I wish we lived nearby so we could try more things on their menu!
Just very good food. The area, building and the decor has something to be desired, but we really like the food and the Thai iced tea with cream.

Delicious food. We ordered red curry, cashew chicken and pad Thai to go. The food more than fed 3 of us. We enjoyed a glass of Chardonnay while we waited. We ordered medium spice/heat, but the red curry was super hot. Ambiance inside was your usual middle of the line Thai restaurant - nothing fancy.

SO salty. And completely over priced. The Tom yum soup is okay but the fried rice and pad see ew noodles were way too salty. I used to come here a lot but the last 3 times it's been on the salty side and this time it was way too much salty. I did complain about it and they still charged us s for something we didn't eat. I personally do not recommend this place.

We love the food here. The curry dishes are fantastic and we seem to always go back to them. We also find the food to be very consistent which is great if you find something you really like, you can expect the same flavor the next time around when you order the dish.  Service/staff is super friendly.  Highly recommended!!

I've eaten here for lunch at least once a week for about two years.  I absolutely love the food here, and the service is fantastic.  It's also a bargain for the price.    Try the #4 medium on the lunch menu or the Hot & Sour soup.  The yellow curry (#2 lunch), red curry (#3 lunch) and the #6 lunch are also delicious.    I love this place!

Yep, definitely a fan of Line Thai. I headed here one day for lunch with my mom and wife and we had a very nice time. The food was really well done and presented nicely.  I had a yellow curry that was spiced well - although I would recommend that if you like spicy Thai food you should not be afraid to go "Thai hot" here since I thought my "hot" was just mild. The dishes my ladies got were also good, but nothing spectacular. This may sound weird, but I have never seen Thai dishes spelled in English the way they do on their menus. It made for some initial confusion until I realized, "Oh, the 'moo priao wan' is actually 'pad priew wan,'" among other things. Of course there are descriptions, so don't freak out. I really enjoyed my lunch there and can't wait to get back to try some dinner!

I've eaten at Thai restaurants in several cities in Thailand.   (The best is simple street-vendor food.)  I've also eaten in many different Thai restaurants in the US.  This restaurant is NOT GOOD.  It wasn't horrible, but was nothing to write home about.    I ordered the laab (they spell it lap).  It was just okay.  I also ordered the Panang curry.  It was terrible.  Panang curry should be a fairly light curry with kafir lime and a special mix of spices and a very subtile hint of peanut.  Their Panang was a very dark, heavy peanut sauce with no hit of what Panang curry should taste like.  Really less than good!    First and last time for this one.

This is my favorite Thai Restaurant! The interior was beautiful, and the service was semi good. The food was delicious, and I really recommend the fried rice and larb beef salad. We have been here twice already and can't wait to go again!

I have been going to this restaurant for over 5 years and keep coming back.  The prices are reasonable and the lunch specials are perfect for a quick meal.  You can expect to see most items priced under $10.00  The fresh Spring Rolls are as good as I have had in Thailand, in fact better.  They have a reasonable quantity of shrimp and are very tasty.  I would not be surprised to find out that they were hand made.  I have not asked.  The Curries are just this side of Heaven and they can make them anyway you want, from mild to THAI HOT. The serving size on curries is large and I usually take home about half of the single serving.   Other dishes are great, and if you ask they will cook any item not on the menu if they have the ingredients.    My only complaint is that they do not have sticky rice.  The coconut ice cream is as good as great.

best thai restaurant in phoenix by far!!!! it's crazy, because this place is in sun city and you would probably not wonder in just by looks, but believe me, it is amazing!!!  i'm from chicago and have had great thai food. this is the best!!! try the #66 ( peanut sauce) with chicken and #65 ( yellow curry)  enjoy, and ask for ying. she is fun, funny and will steer you in the right direction!
Probably the best Thai Restaurant in the valley. Very quaint Mom and Pop style. Lunch Specials are great too!
Best Thai food I've eaten in the Phoenix area.
LOVE this place!! Best food and great pricing!! Service is always wonderful! I've been coming for years and will continue for many more!!

Let me start off by saying, having been a server for 4 years I know what it means to be on a 3 top and to be slammed crazy busy. My husband and I went to this restaurant tonight to give it a try as we both love Thai. Our favorite Thai restaurant is located on the other side of town from us so we wanted to try & find an adequate one a little closer to us. We went on a Sunday night, which I called ahead and asked if they was a long wait, and the lady who answered said, "What do you mean? How many tables do we have in the restaurant?" I said "No, is there a long wait?""Oh no", she said, "we're not busy" before briefly hanging up. That should have been our 1st clue that this wasn't a good pick. We got there to stand in the lobby for about 7 minutes before even being noticed. A waitress took us to our table and put the menus down and didn't say anything, just walked away. After 10 minutes of no service we saw the same waitress seat a table of 4 (older people) take their drink order and bring back their drink order at once. We sat there for 15 minutes before she even came over to take our drink order and by that time, we were beyond ready to order our food. She did not apologize or even seem to care the she just serviced the people she just seated and that we'd been waiting awhile. Our food arrived about 15 minutes later, I had the red curry and my husband had the Pad Thai with shrimp. The food was very mediocre. Our waitress not once came to ask how the food was, even after my husband noticed there were only 2 pieces of pretty small shrimp in his entree, he had to ask the bus boy for help because the waitress was of no help. The bus boy says, "ya it only comes with 2 pieces." Paying for shrimp is already expensive, much less to get ripped off with only 2 small pieces. We sat for awhile waiting for refills & the check. The busboy finally brought our check. We left without a goodbye or thank you from any of the staff. My husband & I are in our 20's, we noticed most of the other guests in the restaurant received better care, we can only assume, because they were older. So, so dissatisfied with this place, will never return.

More flavors and freshness than I have ever experienced at a Thai food restaurant before. #75 fried rice with chicken ( med. In the spicey range was a little hotter than we expected, so it was PERFECT ). Pad Kee Mao chicken was fantastic as well. We visit twice a year from Seattle and drive by other Thai restaurants in order to get there. The atmosphere is Thai and never overly-busy. Service was very quick at 5 pm on a Tue. Drive the extra miles and try this place!

I have eaten here off and on over the years always with enough time elapsed that I forgot why I didn't return.  This time I know fully why I won't.  There is no vegetarian/vegan option among the spring rolls, STRIKE ONE.  Most of the entrees are made to order, so substitution of tofu for the meat takes care of vegan concerns.  I stressed I want the dish to be spicy hot 12 on scale 10, in other words Thai spicy.  Too many Sun City customers have made them timid, at best the dish was about a 7. STRIKE TWO. I asked for their spice rack/tray, I believe they needed to get it out of moth balls. Spice added after the fact is never as flavorful as spice added during cooking, STRIKE THREE.  Now with this posted, I knew why I don't return.

Their curry is amazing. I have disliked Thai curry for a very long time, preferring Japanese curry. But after coming here, my whole curry experience has been revolutionized. The curry noodles and the coconut curry is really good.  Their Pad Thai is the worst Pad Thai I've ever had in my life. I don't even think you can even call it Pad Thai.  I don't know if the other yelpers here have tried Pad Thai before but it's supposed to be sweet and NOT spicy, salty, or SOUR! My husband and I were horrified to taste what they call pad Thai. It was like a Chinese version of sweet and sour spicy pad Thai. I don't even know if that description is correct because we could not figure out what we were tasting.   Another concern is that the bathroom stinks. And you know what they say about how clean a restaurant's bathroom is, it's reflective of the kitchen cleanliness. Just something I thought about.   But besides that.. Their curry is amazing. And we will be coming back just for it.
Exceptional service, very good food, nice quiet environment.

We have been dining here for over 3 years! Both lunch and dinner are wonderful. Full flavors of Thailand. The curry is my favorite! I also love Pad Thai, eggplant, pork and chicken dishes. Staff is very friendly and attentive to our needs. Very fast and reliable service. The half-roasted chicken is the bomb!!
